# Install the packages

Option 1: Install the entire tidyverse  

```{r Install Tidyverse}
install.packages("tidyverse")
```

Option 2: Install dplyr only.  
Only worry about this if you didn't install the tidyverse in the last session.
```{r Install ggplot2}
install.packages("dplyr")
```

## Import the data

```{r}
patients <- read.csv(file = "patient-data-cleaned.txt", sep = "\t")
#patients <- read_tsv("patient-data-cleaned.txt")
```

```{r}
#library("readr")
#patients <- read_tsv("patient-data-cleaned.txt")
patients <- read.csv("patient-data-cleaned.txt", sep = "\t")
```

## Quiz

What relationship do you expect to see between Height & Weight?


```{r}
ggplot(data = patients) +
    geom_point(mapping = aes(x=Weight, y=Height, colour = Sex))
```
